message_1: What is the value of the sine, cosine, and tangent of an angle of 45 degrees?
message_2:
For an angle of 45 degrees (which is equivalent to π/4 radians), the values of sine, cosine, and tangent are as follows:

sin(45°) = sin(π/4) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

cos(45°) = cos(π/4) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

tan(45°) = tan(π/4) = sin(π/4) / cos(π/4) = (√2/2) / (√2/2) = 1
